repnme.cdata!:
Cote d'Ivoire - Competitiveness and
            Regulatory Reform Adjustment Program

abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the Competitiveness and
            Regulatory Reform Adjustment Program for Cote d'Ivoire
            was satisfactory. The project achieved its central
            objectives, institutional development has been partially
            achieved, sustainability is likely, and the performance of
            the Bank was highly satisfactory while the Borrower's
            was satisfactory. Several lessons can be learned from this
            project. First, the project demonstrated that extensive
            collaboration between the Bank staff, Borrower, and private
            sector helps define project components through consensus and
            increases Borrower internalization. Second, the project has
            illustrated the virtues of Bank Group flexibility in
            specific circumstances. Third, private sector development is
            an inevitably slow process that requires considerable time
            before reforms can be expected to generate a supply
            response. Fourth, more effort should be invested in
            educating the Borrowers about the auditing requirements that
            accompany Bank financing. Finally, concise conditionality,
            simplicity of design, and a strong central theme are not
            necessarily incompatible with a complex project.
